THE DIGITAL SOUTH @ UNC

Media and the Movement: Journalism, Civil Rights, and Black Power in the American South

Scholars Involved:

Seth Kotch

Joshua Clark Davis

Charmaine McKissick-Melton

Jerry Gershenhorn

Jacquelyn Dowd Hall

Description:

“Media and the Movement: Journalism, Civil Rights, and Black Power in the American South is an oral history project that aims to understand the media and activism ecosystem of the American South during the civil rights movement of the 1960s, 1970s, and 1980s.” - (Media and the Movement Website)[https://mediaandthemovement.unc.edu/]

See Project's Website launch

Methods: Digital Archives, Digital Publishing

Tags: Digital Publishing, African American History, Southern History (U.S.)

Have questions or notice incorrect information? Email Amanda Henley, Head of Davis Library Digital Research Services

The Digital South is a collaboration between the University Libraries and Southern Futures at the University of North Carolina – Chapel Hill.
